title: Art Collaboration and Authorship Issues
author: Art Collaboration and Authorship Issues
description: Art is not always a one-(wo)man show, although creating art has been romanticised as the brainchild of one particular author/creator. Art, and its various expressions, often result from teamwork and involve multiple parties working together with a shared aim to build a final product.
body: Art is not always a one-(wo)man show, although creating art has been romanticised as the brainchild of one particular author/creator. Art, and its various expressions, often result from teamwork and involve multiple parties working together with a shared aim to build a final product.
conslusion: Art is not always a one-(wo)man show, although creating art has been romanticised as the brainchild of one particular author/creator. Art, and its various expressions, often result from teamwork and involve multiple parties working together with a shared aim to build a final product.
